messageBody:
2008/10/23 David Jackman <david.jackman@...>:
> I haven't really thought this through (so ignore me if I'm missing something
> that should be obvious), but since JUnit now identifies test classes with
> attributes, would there be an advantage to having two different types of
> test classes (i.e. two different attributes): one for test classes that
> behave as they do now and one for test classes that keep the same instance
> for all tests?

I think that can already be implemented with a test runner.

E.g.

@RunWith(SharedInstance.class)
public class BananaTests {
BananaTree tree = growBananaTreeForTenYears();

@Test
public void tastesDelicious()
Banana b = tree.pickBanana();
...
}
...
}


--Nat
